records.text: Can Reflection Dislodge a Faulty Intuition?Some of their studies effectively partitioned respondents into four distinct types: * the reflective, who get the answer right initially; * the careless, who answer incorrectly, but who can solve the problem when told that $10 is not the answer; * the hopeless, who are unable or unwilling to solve the problem; * and the stubborn, who repeat their $10 answer, even after being told it is incorrect.https://insights.som.yale.edu/insights/can-reflection-dislodge-faulty-intuition#Yale #research #reasoning
